body_html: It seems that this has been replaced by tf.feature_column.categorical_column_with_vocabulary_file() which can now handle both sparse and categorical columns? This does appear to be working, but it was a struggle to find the updated functionality as the source code seems to suggest this functionality exists. Is it possible to add any comments to the source code suggesting to look at tf.feature_column.categorical_column_from_vocabulary_file() to help anybody else who may run into this?

body: It seems that this has been replaced by tf.feature_column.categorical_column_with_vocabulary_file() which can now handle both sparse and categorical columns? This does appear to be working, but it was a struggle to find the updated functionality as the source code seems to suggest this functionality exists. Is it possible to add any comments to the source code suggesting to look at tf.feature_column.categorical_column_from_vocabulary_file() to help anybody else who may run into this?
